required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: A Proof of Concept Randomized Controlled Trial of XEN1101 for the Treatment of Major Depressive Disorder
clinical_study.source: Icahn School of Medicine at Mount Sinai

brief_summary.textblock: This project is designed to examine the neuronal KCNQ2/3 potassium (K+) channel subtype as a novel treatment target for mood disorders through the administration of the KCNQ-selective channel opener XEN1101 (Xenon Pharmaceuticals).

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: This is a phase II, randomized, parallel-arm, placebo-controlled clinical trial were 60 patients with major depressive disorder will be randomized in 1:1 fashion to XEN1101 (N=30) or matching placebo (N=30).
study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Change in activation within the reward circuit by fMRI
primary_outcome.description: The change in activation within the bilateral ventral striatum (VS) from baseline (week 0) to end of treatment (week 8) as measured by fMRI during an Incentive Flanker Task.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Montgomery-Åsberg Depression Rating Scale Score
secondary_outcome.description: The Montgomery-Åsberg Depression Rating Scale (MADARS) is a 10-item instrument used for the evaluation of depressive symptoms in adults and for the assessment of any changes to those symptoms. Each of the 10 items is rated on a scale of 0 to 6, with differing descriptors for each item. These individual item scores are added together to form a total score, which can range between 0 and 60 points, higher score indicating poorer health outcomes. The MADRS provides a measure of the overall level of depression.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Quick Inventory of Depressive Symptomatology, Self-Report [QIDS-SR] Score
secondary_outcome.description: The Quick Inventory of Depressive Symptomatology, Self-Report (QIDS-SR) is a 16-item self-rated instrument designed to assess the severity of depressive symptoms. The 16 items cover the nine symptom domains of major depression and are rated on a scale of 0-3. Total score ranges from 0 to 27, with ranges of 0-5 (normal), 6-10 (mild), 11-15 (moderate), 16-20 (moderate to severe), and 21+ (severe).

The Snaith-Hamilton Pleasure Scale (SHAPS) is a well-validated 14-item self-report questionnaire commonly used to assess anhedonia. Each item on the SHAPS is worded so that higher scores indicate greater pleasure capacity. A total score can be derived by summing the responses to each item. Items answered with "strongly agree" are coded as "1", while a "strongly disagree" response was assigned a score of "4." Total scores on the SHAPS can range from 14 to 56, with higher scores corresponding to higher levels of anhedonia.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Temporal Experience of Pleasure Scale
secondary_outcome.description: The Temporal Experience of Pleasure Scale (TEPS) is an 18-item self-report measurement of anhedonia which consists of a series of statements that must be rated according to how accurate they are for the individual. The scale produces a sub-score that differentiates the role of anticipatory pleasure ('wanting') and is derived of 10 items. Total scores range is 16-108. Lower scores indicate greater levels of anhedonia.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Clinical Global Impression Scale
secondary_outcome.description: This is a widely administered clinician rated scale that assesses the subject overall illness severity and the degree of improvement from the initial assessment. Illness severity is rated on a 1-7 scale where 1 corresponds to "Normal, Not at All Ill", 2 is "Borderline Mentally Ill", the anchor for 3 is "Mildly Ill", the anchor for 4 is "Moderately Ill", 5 is "Markedly Ill", 6 is "Severely Ill", and 7 is "Among the Most Extremely Ill Patients". The degree of improvement is rated on a 1-7 scale where 1 corresponds to "Very Much Improved", 2 is "Much Improved", the anchor for 3 is "Minimally Improved", the anchor for 4 is "No Change", 5 is "Minimally Worse", 6 is "Much Worse", and 7 is "Very Much Worse".

arm_group.description: Subjects will take two 10 mg capsules of XEN1101 daily for 8 weeks for a total daily dose of 20 mg.
Subjects will take a matching placebo daily for eight weeks.

overall_official.affiliation: Icahn School of Medicine at Mount Sinai

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Icahn School of Medicine at Mount Sinai

patient_data.ipd_description: All of the individual participant data collected during the trial, after deidentification.
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: Immediately following publication. No end date.
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: Investigators whose proposed use of the data has been approved by an independent review committee identified for this purpose. Any purpose. Other NDCT Database
